e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it would eliminate the bias in reported earnings, fostering a culture of transparency and integrity. Although some investors may initially misunderstand the true earnings, over time, the consistent reporting of unbiased earnings will build trust and strengthen the company's reputation. Additionally, this shift mitigates legal risks associated with misleading financial practices, aligning with ethical standards and regulatory expectations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness. It must provide clear and truthful representations of financial performance without any intentional bias or misleading information. Considerations include the potential impact on all stakeholders, ensuring that investors can make informed decisions based on reliable data. Additionally, the policy should comply with legal regulations and accounting standards to prevent manipulation and maintain the company's integrity.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to effectively communicate the change in policy to investors to prevent misunderstandings. Additionally, I would like to know what measures will be taken to monitor investor reactions and adjust communications as needed. It is also crucial to understand how the new policy may impact future investor relations and overall financial strategy.
